Serial LSMLIB Package

The Serial LSMLIB package provides support for carrying out level set method calculations using a single processor. Specifically, it provides C data structures and functions for:

  • management of the computational grid and data arrays;
  • initialization of the level set function for several simple geometries;
  • application of common boundary conditions;
  • computation of the distance function and extension fields using fast marching methods; and
  • general utility functions (e.g. copying data, computing the max norm of a grid function, etc.).

Grid and Data Array Management

lsm_grid.h defines data structures and functions for creating and managing computational grids in two- and three-dimensions. lsm_data_arrays.h defines data structures and functions for creating and managing data arrays containing values of field variables on the computational grid.

Initialization of Level Set Functions

lsm_initialization2d.h and lsm_initialization3d.h provide functions to initialize a level set function so that its zero level set has specified geometry. Geometries supported include:

2D 3D
intersection of half-planes intersection of half-spaces
intersection of circles intersection of spheres
intersection of rectangles intersection of boxes
intersection of cylinders
intersection of hyperboloids
intersection of cones

Boundary Conditions

lsm_boundary_conditions.h provide functions for setting the ghostcells in the computational grid to impose common boundary conditions used in level set method calculations. Currently, extrapolation and homogenous Neumann (e.g. zero normal derivative) boundary conditions are supported.

Fast Marching Method

lsm_fast_marching_method.h provides functions for computing distance functions, extending field variables off of the zero level set, and solving the Eikonal equation using first-order accurate fast marching methods.
